title: Quiet-STaR: Language Models Can Teach Themselves to Think Before Speaking
dot:
digraph QuietSTAR{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];Paper[label="Quiet-STaR: Language Models Can Teach Themselves to Think Before Speaking
Eric Zelikman et al.
(arXiv:2403.09629)", shape=ellipse];Reasoning[label="Reasoning in Language Models"];STaR[label="Self-Taught Reasoner (STaR)
- Learn from few-shot examples
- Infer rationales for answers"];QuietSTaR[label="Quiet-STaR
- Generalization of STaR
- Generate rationales for each token"];Challenges[label="Key Challenges
1. Computational cost
2. Initial lack of internal thoughts
3. Predicting beyond next tokens"];Solutions[label="Proposed Solutions
- Tokenwise parallel sampling
- Learnable tokens for thoughts
- Extended teacher-forcing technique"];Improvements[label="Improvements
- Better predictions
- Zero-shot performance on GSM8K and CommonsenseQA
- Perplexity improvement"]; Paper->Reasoning;Paper->STaR;Paper->QuietSTaR;QuietSTaR->Challenges;QuietSTaR->Solutions;Solutions->Improvements;Reasoning->"Implicit reasoning in text";STaR->"Rationales from few-shot examples";Improvements->"No fine-tuning required";}
